attributes.action: Keep the Christmas lights in Central London on until February 1.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics show January 24th is the "saddest" day of the year but we all know most of January is pretty depressing... it's cold, you're broke from Christmas & you've probably put on 10kgs from those December parties. Let's turn that frown upside & keep the festive spirit alive. Let's start 2017 the right way! Let's keep the lights on!
attributes.background: The Christmas lights in the central London shopping districts bring joy to locals & tourists alike so why take them down just at the beginning of January?

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the London Assembly. 
 
The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: 
 
https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
